channel.title: CVE Feed for Rails -- https://github.com/rails/rails
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Rails -- https://github.com/rails/rails

item.title: CVE-2019-5418|2024-08-04T19:54:53.606Z -- rails -- https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Frails%2Frails
item.description: There is a File Content Disclosure vulnerability in Action View <5.2.2.1, <5.1.6.2, <5.0.7.2, <4.2.11.1 and v3 where specially crafted accept headers can cause contents of arbitrary files on the target system's filesystem to be exposed.

item.title: CVE-2019-5419|2024-08-04T19:54:53.468Z -- rails -- https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Frails%2Frails
item.description: There is a possible denial of service vulnerability in Action View (Rails) <5.2.2.1, <5.1.6.2, <5.0.7.2, <4.2.11.1 where specially crafted accept headers can cause action view to consume 100% cpu and make the server unresponsive.

item.title: CVE-2019-5420|2024-08-04T19:54:53.584Z -- rails -- https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Frails%2Frails
item.description: A remote code execution vulnerability in development mode Rails <5.2.2.1, <6.0.0.beta3 can allow an attacker to guess the automatically generated development mode secret token. This secret token can be used in combination with other Rails internals to escalate to a remote code execution exploit.
